sense.name: a mental grasp or understanding of something
sense.commentary: APPRECIATION[+state][+mental][+understanding][+of_domain] Note: implies knowledge or awareness of something
sense.examples: Their company has a good appreciation of the needs of their clients. This job requires a good appreciation of basic accounting principles. They showed little appreciation for the how difficult it will be to overcome these obstacles.

sense.name: an aesthetic sensibility, discriminating taste
sense.commentary: APPRECIATION[+quality][+ability][+discrimination][+aesthetic] Note: implies taste related to aesthetic judgment (related to Sense 1, but with a narrower reading)
sense.examples: Mary is teaching a music appreciation class at the community college. A man with such appreciation of fine wine will not enjoy this jug wine from the grocery store.

sense.name: a feeling of gratitude
sense.commentary: APPRECIATION[+state][+emotional][+gratitude] Note: implies the agent feels pleased and indebted to another
sense.examples: We should all show our appreciation to Sally for all the help she gave us during this project. He expressed his appreciation to the restaurant management in a short note. She smiled in appreciation as the man offered her his seat on the bus.

sense.name: an increase in monetary value
sense.examples: The appreciation of home real estate in this area has been 70 percent in the past two years. Traders are expecting a continued appreciation of the euro against the US dollar.
